name: Palazzo Versace

reviews.text: Stayed for a week and started off with wrong room allocation after having confirmed room requirements 2 months earlier.Lost our laundry and wanted to charge us for the cleaning. No compensation offered even though housekeeping admitted item lost ( they finally relented after going through 4 "managers" ).
reviews.title: Very overrated at 5 stars

likes.disliked: — Generally run down (dusty, nice pool but dirty ,torn sheet , lost laundry )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool dirty , torn sheets and generally run down compared to previous visit 2-3 years earlier . Much better value elsewhere eg Sheraton Mirage .
reviews.title: Opulent, but not my style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will not return to Versace !!!
reviews.title: Classy. Perfect for our honeymoon

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in October 2007. The lobby has a quiet opulence, and upon entering, you immediately notice a pleasant, spicy scent that is apparent throughout the hotel. We wondered if it was fed through the air conditioning system! Reception staff were friendly, though slightly aloof. We had booked a superior room which was beautifully furnished but very small. A large spa bath occupies one end of the room (the bathroom area is not closed off from the rest of the room), and the toilet and shower are separated by frosted glass panels. This is not a place to stay if you are shy around your travelling companion! We were surprised to find one of the sink taps chipped and loose. Staff were helpful with any requests. One useful tip - hotel postcards will be franked for free if you hand them in to reception. The pool area is beautiful and particularly nice for breakfast and snacks. I probably wouldn't stay here again; although I'm glad I had the experience, it really wasn't my style,and for the money I believe I can find more informal accommodation elsewhere on the Gold Coast.
reviews.title: Nice if you're into that style

reviews.text: A very stylish hotel. We did not leave our room for most of the time we spent at the hotel. It is not as big as one would expect for a five star but had a class of its own.
reviews.title: the best place on the gold coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i stayed at palazzzo versace from 21 may to 1 june, best hotel ever visited we stayed 11 nights and had the time best time ever the staff were very freindly and helpful, buffet breakfast was 5 star and had everything you could imagine. we will definitley go again only with children next time also cannot wait for dubai palazzo versace to be finished and to go and stay there.
reviews.title: paula

likes.liked: — evrything was great no favourite thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there on our honeymoon...I loved the hotel :)
reviews.title: LOOOOVED IT :)

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated..everything was "Versace".
reviews.title: Huge dissapointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was so romantic at night..they used tealights and lamps which gave the place a very warm touch.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: Be sure to try the inroom spa packages. I personally chose the marshmallow bath and it was above my expectations.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations - Highly Recommend this hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in early August and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I guess it's easier to give a positive review when we weren't the one's paying for the room, but it was still a great experience.
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

likes.disliked: — Noisy pool guests at unreasonable hours of the morning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely, EVERYTHING bears the Versace touch and logo, so I can understand why some people have labelled the place overdone and tacky, but it is the Gold Coast, so it works.
reviews.title: It is a sliceof heaven

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds, very large and sumptuous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the complimentary fragrances in the rooms, the spa bath was divine as was the comfort of the beds. Our room had a lagoon view and that was gorgeous, apart from some noisy guests around the pool area at 12-1am!
reviews.title: Tacky & Overrated!!

reviews.text: The staff were extremely attentive, friendly and professional at ALL times during our stay - couldn't fault them.
reviews.title: 5 star all the way

likes.disliked: — Lack of Storage space in bathroom

reviews.text: The breakfast selection is like nothing I've ever seen before. Fabuous! They serve anything you could possibly want for breakfast in elegant surrounds and on their gorgeous Versace dinnerware.
reviews.title: Great Service!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, Breakfast and the pool!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Versace last year. Our planned stay was for 4 days, however for my son and I it was only one night as a 100kg flower urn by the pool fell onto his leg crushing it and we spent the next 3 weeks in hospital. The hotel were helpful while we were in Queensland. We transfered to a NSW hospital as soon as we could. The urn and the rest of the urns in the pool area were unsafe and my son is lucky to be alive. I am advised that they are now all re-enforced with steel. This obviously has coloured my experience of the hotel but I must say that proir to that the service was patchy, some good some totaly indifferent. The food was average. It is packed to the gunnels with bling and Versace over the topness. Personally I found it garish and ugly. I wouldn't reccomend this hotel to families as there are so many dangers for children around the pool area. To get to the lift from the pool there is an acre of marble floor which the slightest wet foot will slip on. The afore mentioned urns. The high walls around the edge, very pretty but an easy place for a toddler to fall off etc etc.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: We have stayed at many luxury hotels over the world. This is one of the WORST!!! This is supposed to be a Leading Hotel of The World... Its an absolute joke.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here - What a Disaster

likes.disliked: — Staying There for as long as i did

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IF YOU UNDERSTAND THE SIMPLE POINT THAT THE MONEY YOU WORK HARD FOR IS EXCHANGED FOR A LEVEL OF SERVICE AND EXCLUSIVE AMMENETIES AT A HOTEL THEN DONT STAY AT THE PALAZO VERSACE!!!
reviews.title: Fantatsic start to our Honeymoon

reviews.text: IF YOU WANT TO STAY THERE CAUSE ITS THE VERSACE HOTEL THEN CONTACT ME AND I'LL SEND YOU A PICTURE OF MY ROOM SERVICE FOOD... THAT SHOULD PUT YOU OFF!!!
reviews.title: Loved the Palazzo Versace - even if overpriced

reviews.text: We stayed in a Lagoon View Room with a seperate living area and a balcony (About the size of box of paper)
reviews.title: Wow

likes.disliked: — It's across the road from the beach....and it's a busy road.

description: Nestled between the Pacific Ocean and the Gold Coast Broadwater, Palazzo Versace Gold Coast is ‘a destination within a destination’. A waterfront setting, spectacular architecture, Italian furnishings, extraordinary service and an ambience of pure glamour. Palazzo Versace is everything you would expect from the world’s first fully fashion-branded hotel; home to three award winning restaurants, famed day spa, Fitness & Wellbeing Centre, private marina, Versace Boutique and access to Australia’s first Water Salon poolside cabana experience. Housing 200 light-filled rooms in timeless craftsmanship accessorised by Bespoke Versace furnishing and a ‘Juliet’ balcony inviting the Gold Coast sunshine and azure skies to pour in.With a glorious sub-tropical climate; cosmopolitan approach to life; and the beauty of a Renaissance palace, Palazzo Versace creates the perfect holiday and the ultimate escapism.
